channel.title: ADHD is an excuse
channel.description:
I see ADHD as an excuse for bad parenting. http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/health/8232633.stm
Allowing children with attention-deficit disorders to "queue jump" at theme parks could be doing them more harm than good, one expert suggests. Children with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) are given passes in most theme parks if they can prove they have the condition.
Thats crazy!

item.title: ADHD is an excuse
item.dc:creator: @933pm 933pm
item.description:
@933pm wrote:

Mopman:

I don’t think the line skipping is designed to help the kid, I think it’s designed so that the theme park staff and public don’t have to deal with their hyperactivity when in line.

+1

Read full topic

item.title: ADHD is an excuse
item.dc:creator: @Unlimited1 .Unlimited
item.description:
@Unlimited1 wrote:

[quote=“Tico, post:6, topic:299479”][quote author=chrisn2323 link=topic=395807.msg2940360#msg2940360 date=1251836950]

  1. Its fucking hard to concentrate

  2. u get fidgety

  3. try reading with ADHD, I read the same line 99999 times without meds

  4. u space out a lot
    [/quote]

I have almost all of those, but I don’t have ADHD. :|[/quote]

You’re Tico that explains everything.

If someone with ADHD is made to sit in line (just making a guess here) it might help them because they have to wait in line like the rest of us.

Read full topic

item.title: ADHD is an excuse
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:7, topic:299479”][quote author=Tico link=topic=395807.msg2940371#msg2940371 date=1251837609]

  1. Its fucking hard to concentrate

  2. u get fidgety

  3. try reading with ADHD, I read the same line 99999 times without meds

  4. u space out a lot

I have almost all of those, but I don’t have ADHD.
[/quote]
Are you sure you don’t have ADHD?
You might not know.[/quote]

Yup, my mom noticed it when i was around 5-10 years old, so I got checked for it, but I still wasn’t diagnosed with ADHD.

Read full topic

item.title: ADHD is an excuse
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

chrisn2323:

This has more to do with the UK being retarded than anything else. I have ADHD and yes it affects me, but queue-jumping because of it isn’t necessary.

explain please how it affects you.

Allowing children with attention-deficit disorders to "queue jump" at theme parks could be doing them more harm than good, one expert suggests.
